text:
Me encanta este TLoZ aunque aún no lo acabo xD lo acabaré algún día, pero por el momento tengo muchos juegos pendientes para terminar.

Este Zelda tiene un encanto que los demás no te dan. Me da la sensación de que es un cuento de hadas por toda la onda de los minish. Sin duda los juegos de diseño Toon son los más adorables <3
author: Pow_Hammer04

text: Underrated Zelda game. Although first time I played it I didn't like so much, but every other times I've played it I absolutely adored it.
author: Eirian Odalis

text: Ame este juego demasiado <3 Vaati es un canijo extremadamente adorable xD y batalle un buen para derrotarlo al final!! cada ves que salia transformación tras transformación me dolía la cabeza xDD los minish en especial me gustaron bastante!! son tan lindos! en verdad de mis juegos fav de zelda c; ezero i luv u
author: NekoItoSan

text: One of those underrated Zelda games. It's not great in a few areas, but it has so much chaaaaaarm :s.
author: greenyxi

text: I got this game recently at my local game store. If I wasn't in the middle of Oracle of Ages I'd totally be playing it right now.
author: Moop Bread

text: Oracle of Ages? Way to throw a fuckton of nostalgia at us. xD
author: Kennith Morgan

text:
no game will ever be as important for me, as this one... all the memories.
not only cause its the beginning of the timeline, where our hero receives his green cap, but also cause of the melodies and the retro style. oh my...  this soundtrack means so much to me :')
author: Toby. Z

text: as weird as it sounds, this was my first GBA and The Legend of Zelda game I buyed back in the day.
author: Owari Dragon

text: Underated Zelda game, it was awesome.
author: ironeise

text: My fav Zelda game
author: Louis Claudel

text: I started and i got stuck very fast -.-'
author: Kakashi Hatake

text:
that one temple you had to redo over and over and over and over every other hour just completely killed it for me.
It hat other flaws too, like the controls being extremely gimmicky just for the sake of it, weak story and one of the worst art design choices other than those just copy & pasted from WW. 
It had a few really creative moments in the regular dungeons, still it hasn't lived up even close to the expectations of a Wind Waker sequel.
author: Lories PM

text: You talk about Phantom Hourglass. This is Minish Cap from the GBA
author: Kilikicker

text: Why was Phantom Hourglass bad?  Admittedly I haven't played it much, but...

text: My sentiments exactly.

text: minish cap was brief, but totally lovely & polished. capcom's handheld zeldas are gr8

text: Well, you're just lame.
author: armando1is1great

text: Ugh. Minish Cap is one of my least favorite Zeldas, possibly even lower on the totem pole than Twilight Princess, or maybe even Spirit Tracks.
author: Eli F

text:
Minish Cap got a lot of hate back when it came out, didn't it? Handheld Zeldas were always kind of weird, but it wasn't nearly such a trainwreck as Phantom Hourglass was. 
I liked it quite a bit.
author: Lories PM

text: Even Navi waited for you to ask unless it was REALLY important.
author: EvilMariobot

text: Indeed Mnish Cap is an underrated Zelda game, it had great music, well designed world and dungeons and unique equipment for Link. The only thing that really bothered me was the stupid over-tutorialization of the game: Like, you see a room, a switch, get the idea of which item to use and then Ezlo interrupts you to state the obvious and make you feel stupid. Why can't he wait for you to ask?
author: Ce1es

text: Thanks for this!  Minish Cap doesn't get the recognition it deserves.
author: totlyepic

text: I've been recently playing this game as well.
author: ParrotMan01

text: Uuuhh, every time I hear this makes me want to play the whole game again.
author: Fabio Salluzzo

text: Love this game :D
author: Redfoxe

text: I remember when I first got this from my brother for my birthday, I was really excited to play it so I told my friends at the lunch table about it. And someone called it Minish Crap, which kinda pissed me off lol
author: aLLtimEgameR123

text: Reminds me of the harvest moon for snes music
author: SlRDancealot

text: I think games like this showed the true beauty that pixel sprits are capable of. Hopefully even has handhelds move toward 3d renders the indie game market will keep the art alive for good.
author: KatOtter

text: The good days of top down Zelda games, before stylus controls ruined everything.
author: jdng86

text: Yeah, which is why I didn't mention Twilight Princess (awesome soundtrack). I was strictly talking about the handheld Zelda games that followed Minish Cap. Minegishi went for a completely different style on the DS since those games are lot more light hearted than TP, but the music ended up being very average save for a few standout tunes in Spirit Tracks.
author: SupraDarky

text: Hey now... Toru Minegishi single-handedly composed most of Twilight Princess which is one of my favourite soundtracks of all time. His Zelda music is special to me at least.
author: Daniel Berry

text: I didn't realize the same guy did both DS Zeldas. Hourglass...bleh. The only Zelda I've never finished. Spirit Tracks is amazing though. The little things they changed in it made all the difference, especially in the central dungeon.

text: Even if Minish Cap is kind of generic compared to the other games in the series, it's still one of my favorites. I just love the atmosphere.

text:
Hm, I may have to disagree about Spirit Tracks.  Had a bunch of memorable good beat songs that fit the game.  

Otherwise, I agree with your opinion.  Such a fun game and the music just helps enhance the experience.

text: This is my favorite Zelda game along with Wind Waker :D

text: Oh, and I'd really like a Minish Cap 2. I feel like they could bring tons of new and fresh ideas with mini Link.
author: SupraDarky

text: Oh man, thanks for uploading this! My favourite 2D Zelda game and what a soundtrack. Mt. Crenel's theme is equally incredible.
author: Woodo

text: I remember when I first went into﻿ the Minish Woods at the beginning of the game, I knew the soundtrack was in good hands. It's a short but memorable theme, just like Link to the Past's Lost Woods, which served﻿ as an inspiration (the high strings from 0:26 to 0:35 especially). I feel like Takano really understood what makes Zelda music so special, unlike Toru Minegishi who couldn't quite get away from his Animal Crossing sound in Phantom Hourglass and Spirit Tracks.
author: SupraDarky
